speaker: Skyline
text: Lights come on in various buildings._   [_Scene 1 - Cafe Nervosa Daphne and Niles are standing in front of the counter holding hands._]

speaker: Daphne
text: It's official.  Dr. Lee says we're pregnant.  [_They chuckle warmly and embrace._]

speaker: Niles
text: I'm so excited!  [_He kneels and speaks to Daphne's tummy._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello in there!  It's your pater.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, stop it. [_She sits._] So, how do you want to make the announcement?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, well, Frasier's on his way over.  We could...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_interrupting_] No!  He's a blabbermouth.  Let's have him and your dad over for dinner tonight, and we can tell them at the same time.

speaker: Niles
text: If you already had a plan, why did you ask me how I wanted to do it?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, because if you'd have had the same idea, then I could have agreed with it, which would have given you the illusion of control. [_After a beat._] The waiting room had "Cosmo."

speaker: Niles
text: Ohh.  All right.  Ah! - I have just the quotation for the beginning of the announcement.  It's from Robert Burns: "Beneath the shelter of an aged tree, Th' expectant wee-things, toddlin', stacher through [_gradually taking on a gaelic accent and goofy facial expression_] To meet their dad, wi' filchterin' noise and glee." [_Off Daphne's bemused reaction._] Moving, eh?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_rising_] Yes, but not just because of the poem, I'm late for a hair appointment.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  [_They kiss.  As Daphne leaves, Frasier approaches._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, you two!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Daph, good to see you. [_Daphne exits._] Hello, Niles.  Uh, my usual, please. Well, I've ruined another relationship.  I suppose you'll want to hear the whole sorry tale. [_They sit._]

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, no thank you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Last night, Julia came over and, as usual, I made a mess of things... Did you say no?

speaker: Niles
text: I said, "No, thank you."

speaker: Frasier
text: But I wish to unburden myself.

speaker: Niles
text: And I wish to remain in my good mood.  Therefore, I demur.

speaker: Frasier
text: You demur?

speaker: Niles
text: I demur.  Besides, I'm sure I've heard it all before.

speaker: Frasier
text: But this time was different... Both: I really thought she could have been the one!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_wounded_] Well.  Silly me.  To think that I could count on my only brother for shoulder on which to lean.

speaker: Niles
text: What you need isn't a shoulder, it's a swift boot to break you out of this pattern.

speaker: Frasier
text: What pattern?

speaker: Niles
text: Your pattern of ruining things before they've even begun.

speaker: Frasier
text: And when have I done that?

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm, let me see: Faye [_S6_], Cassandra [_S6_], Chelsea [_S10_], Claire [_S8-9_], Lana [_S7-9_], Abby [_S8_], Mia [_S7_], Marie [_S6_]...  [_N.B. To review these past relationships, refer to the comprehensive list at the head of[[9.02]](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_2/don_juan_in_hell_2.html "Don Juan in Hell \[2\]") "Don Juan In Hell [II]" -- an episode which, by the way, was focused on Frasier trying to break out of this pattern._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right!  I knew I had a pattern, I just didn't think you'd remember the names.

speaker: Niles
text: The minute you develop feelings for someone, you get scared and find some way to sabotage things.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd like to strike you, of course, but you speak the truth. I'll tell you what, I will never find a happy relationship un-unless I can break out of this maddening cycle.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right.  The next time you find yourself doing it again, fixating, say on some tiny fault in the woman, recognize what that is: you're feeling vulnerable.  But don't give in to the fear.  Commit to commitment.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_a bit annoyed_] Commit to commitment.  It's a bit glib, but nonetheless inspiring.  Thank you, Niles.  I'm going to call Julia, and I will not take "no" for an answer.  I may have walked in here the old fault-finding, flaw-fleeing Flasier, but I leave a man committed to commitment.

speaker: Niles
text: [_smiling_] You said "Flasier."

speaker: Frasier
text: I did not.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, you did.

speaker: Frasier
text: I most certainly did not.

speaker: Niles
text: I heard you say "Flasier."

speaker: Frasier
text: I've been saying my own name for the last forty-some odd years.

speaker: Niles
text: I know, but your tongue...  [_As they continue to argue the point, we fade out._]  [_Scene 2 - Frasier's apartment Frasier enters, carrying a package._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Before you say anything, if you know the score to the Mariners game, don't tell me, I'm taping it to watch later.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, the odds of my knowing the score to the Mariners game are about the same as you knowing the score to Pacific Overtures. Did, uh, Julia call?

speaker: Martin
text: No, sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, damn.  Well, at least this little delivery will cheer me up.  My new Frette hand towels have arrived.  Ha, ha! [_opening the package and examining the towels_] Direct from Italy, I give you the _spugna con frangia_ , with the tulle lace insert, huh?

speaker: Martin
text: Sounds fancy, am I allowed to dry my hands on them?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you may miss the luxurious feel of your trouser fronts, but yes.

speaker: Martin
text: You know, if you're really down about this Julia thing, you can come with me and Eddie to the _circus_.  We're really going to the V-E-T, but if I say that, he won't get in the car.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks anyway, Dad. I'll just see you at Niles and Daphne's for dinner, all right.  Maybe I'll take in a movie.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, what are you going to go see?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's this new Russian film in town about a Crimean War vet.  [_At this, Eddie runs out the door and down the hall._]

speaker: Martin
text: No, Eddie!  Would it have killed you to say Crimean War circus?  [_Martin chases after Eddie._]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so sorry, Dad, I...  [_The elevator dings, and Julia exits._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Julia!  You got my message!  Oh.  [_He embraces her, but she doesn't return it._]

speaker: Julia
text: What message?  I actually came because I think I dropped an earring here last night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  I'm sorry. Well, please, please come in. [_They enter the apartment._] So, what did it look like?

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, it was just a small diamond stud. [_She begins to look on the couch._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, okay, yeah, you check there, and I'll...

speaker: Julia
text: So, uh, what was this message?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_searching on his knees near Martin's chair_] Um, oh, I just said that I found you bright, and uh, beautiful and engaging, and then... there was a sonnet: "Fair love's ship ne'er sailed o'er unstorm'd seas.  The fickle stars, her compass, bright and cruel..." [_pausing_] It's pretty sappy stuff, huh?

speaker: Julia
text: No, it's sweet.  Especially the end.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you did hear it?  [_They rise and approach each other._]

speaker: Julia
text: Yes, but Frasier, I'm not looking for just some office romance. I don't see the point in getting involved unless it's heading somewhere.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's exactly where I am in my life too.  After you walked out last night, I realized how badly I want to be in a real relationship, how ready I am to...well, for want of a better phrase, uh, to commit to commitment.

speaker: Julia
text: You're not just saying this to get in my pants, are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No. And if I did...get in your pants, well...I'd want to stay there forever.  I-I said that much more elegantly in the sonnet.

speaker: Julia
text: You know, I just remembered where I may have lost my earring.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really, where?

speaker: Julia
text: In your bedroom.  Do you care to help me look?

speaker: Frasier
text: In my bed...well, we were never in my bedroom, I don't...  [_Julia gives him a strongly hinting glance and smile._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  I see.  [_They hold hands and walk back.  Fade out._]  _END OF ACT I   ACT II_  **THE BASTIE BOYS**  [_Scene 3 - Frasier's apartment Daphne, Niles, and Martin enter, Daphne with a bag, Niles with a pan._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Let's hope Frasier's oven is more reliable than ours. [_She heads for the kitchen._]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it serves you right for getting such a fancy one.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, it's just temperamental.  My Gaggenau is German-engineered. It probably needs more power than my building's old wiring can give it.

speaker: Martin
text: Leave it to the Germans.  Even their appliances crave power.  [_Cut to the kitchen.  Niles and Daphne.  Martin enters._]

speaker: Daphne
text: So, when do you want to make the big announcement?

speaker: Niles
text: I think a toast before dinner.

speaker: Daphne
text: Let's hope Frasier checks his messages after the movie.  Or he'll be headed over to our place.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well I'm sure he will.  It's just as well not to have him here while we're cooking.  I can't stand his backseat basting.  [_Cut to Frasier's bedroom.  Frasier and Julia after sex in bed._]

speaker: Julia
text: I was just dreaming about us.  We were in a boat, floating down the Arno River.

speaker: Frasier
text: Have you ever been to fair Firenze?

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, it's maybe my favorite city.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mine, too.  Oh, I knew we'd be a good couple.

speaker: Julia
text: [_laughing_] Have you ever gone there for Christmas?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  I've always wanted to.

speaker: Julia
text: Me too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then let's go!

speaker: Julia
text: Do you mean it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sounds perfect! [_They kiss._]  I'll tell you what.  Let's toast this decision with a glass of Chianti.

speaker: Julia
text: Ooh, that sounds good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, shoot.

speaker: Julia
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: I just remembered I'm supposed to have dinner at my brother and his wife's house tonight.  I'm just going to call and cancel.  [_Cut to the kitchen.  Niles's cell phone rings._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_answering_] Hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_v.o._] Niles, it's-it's Frasier. Listen, [_cut to the bedroom_] I just got out of the movie, and it was so cold in the theater that I think I've...[_feigning a hoarse voice.  Julia laughs._] I think I've come down with a little something, and uh, I just...I just... I'm afraid I'm begging out tonight, all right?

speaker: Niles
text: [_v.o._] Oh, I hardly think a little dinner will make you worse. [_Cut to the kitchen_] And besides, we've had a change of plans.  [_Cut to the bedroom.  Frasier rises, covering himself with a blanket._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, for God's sakes, I just want to go home and get into bed.  [_He begins to exit the bedroom.  Julia follows, covering herself with a sheet.  Cut back to kitchen/living room._]

speaker: Niles
text: But, Daphne and I have put in a lot of effort into making a very nice dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_moving into the living room_] I can't help it if I'm sick.  What if I catch pneumonia?  [_Niles has now moved into the living room, and sees Frasier, followed by Julia.  Frasier, compromised, hangs up his phone._]

speaker: Niles
text: If that's what you wear to the movies, it's your own damn fault.

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell are you doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: My oven's on the fritz.  We left you a message hours ago.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry, Niles, uh, you remember Julia, of course.  [_Niles makes an affirmative, uncomfortable gesture._]

speaker: Julia
text: Well, if he didn't before, he certainly will now.  Excuse me.  [_She exits to the bedroom._]

speaker: Niles
text: You lied to me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  Would you have rather I told you that I was _in flagrante delicto?_

speaker: Niles
text: No, but you're still not excused from dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Julia and I would be delighted to attend.

speaker: Niles
text: Er, we weren't planning on including Julia...

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what do you want me to do, give her fifty bucks and tell her to beat it? [_He exits._]  [_Scene 4 - Frasier's apartment Time fade.  Julia, now dressed, is on the couch, speaking to Martin._]

speaker: Julia
text: Ten years! I-if I still needed a cane after that long, I'd dump my physical therapist and find one who knows what they're doing.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_entering from the kitchen, setting the table.  Coldly._] Hello.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, actually, this is her.  She's also my daughter-in-law. Daphne, this is Julia.

speaker: Julia
text: Sorry about that. [_laughs_]

speaker: Daphne
text: That's all right.  And just so you know, he wouldn't need the cane so much if he'd stretch more.

speaker: Julia
text: I'd have thought that part of your job was making sure he stretched.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, but, I can't be here day and night.

speaker: Julia
text: I'm sorry, for some reason I thought you lived here.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_forcing a smile_] Well, I don't.  [_Daphne exits to kitchen.  Frasier enters from the bedroom._]

speaker: Frasier
text: How about some Mozart to make things festive, huh?  [_He turns on the music._]

speaker: Julia
text: Well, I'm not sure I'd call that festive.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then you'd be wrong, as it is from the Salzburg Music Festival.

speaker: Julia
text: How about something a little more contemporary.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right.  I believe I have Michael Nyman's _The Contemporary Trumpet._

speaker: Julia
text: What are you, a hundred? [_Throughout the scene, she continues to smile and laugh through her insensitive comments and barbs._]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, nothing then, my little wasp. [_He chuckles, still in a good mood.  Niles enters with drinks._]  Oh, thank you, Niles. Thank you very much.

speaker: Niles
text: You're welcome [_to Julia_] and there you go.

speaker: Julia
text: [_taking Martin's beer_] Oh, perfect, thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: [_awkardly_] Oh, uh, [_turning to Martin in his chair_] there you are.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sotto voce_] She took my...

speaker: Niles
text: [_also_] Just take it.

speaker: Martin
text: She took my...

speaker: Niles
text: I don't care.  Just take it, take it.  [_Martin takes a glass of champagne, grudgingly.  He glares in Julia's direction._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_still cheerful_] She, uh, shoots from the hip, this one.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: You should hear what she says about my show.

speaker: Julia
text: I just have to remind Mr. Pompous here that what we do on the radio is entertainment.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well...

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, Frasier and I have had many a chat about the difference between what he does and genuine psychiatry.

speaker: Julia
text: Yeah, big difference.  I mean, at least his advice is free, not like those quacks who charge 200 bucks an hour to whine about their childhoods.  I mean, what a racket that is!

speaker: Niles
text: [_after a beat_] Frasier, may I see you in the kitchen?  [_They both proceed there._]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, what are you doing in the kitchen?

speaker: Frasier
text: You just asked to see me.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, so you haven't gone deaf.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why would I have gone deaf?

speaker: Niles
text: Because that's the only good reason you sat there silently while our profession was assaulted like a drag queen at a tractor pull!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, don't be so sensitive.  That is one of the qualities I admire most about Julia--her bracing frankness.  Now listen, listen, it is partially because of your advice that I have chosen to commit myself to this woman, so please at least give her a chance.

speaker: Niles
text: You're right.  If you're happy, I'm happy.  Help me serve.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right, okay.  [_They enter the dining area._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dinner is served, everyone, if you'd come and take a seat.  Here we are. Daph, I'll let you sit here.  Julia, have a seat there, and I'll sit right next to you.

speaker: Niles
text: [_after Martin assists him_] Thanks, Dad. [_He remains standing._]  And before we begin, I would like to share some words of Robert Burns which have recently become quite meaningful to me: [_starting the "accent" a little earlier this time_] "Beneath the shelter of an aged tree..."  [_He is interrupted by a cell phone._]

speaker: Julia
text: Whoops, that's me. [_taking the call and remaining at the table_] Hello?  Hey, what's up?  No, no, I can talk.  Well, what kind of crap is that?  Nail their asses to the wall! [_covering the mouthpiece_] Is that chicken?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, partridge.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, in a champagne and orange sauce.

speaker: Julia
text: [_into the phone_] 'Cause he's a pissy little bitch, that's why. [_covering again_] I'm sorry, I don't eat birds, they live in their own feces.

speaker: Martin
text: [_stabbing a piece of partridge_] More for me!

speaker: Julia
text: I'll just get some cereal. [_to the phone_] Well, let him sue, I'm starting to think you've got a little pair of panties on under that suit. [_She goes to the kitchen during the last speech._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_after a beat_] You know, she really does work too hard.

speaker: Niles
text: Back to what I was saying: "Beneath the shelter of an aged tree..."

speaker: Julia
text: [_from the kitchen_] Okay, I give up, where do you keep your cereal?

speaker: Daphne
text: Please, Julia, sit, we'll find you something. [_She rises._]

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, are you sure?

speaker: Niles
text: [_refusing to give up, faster now_] "Beneath the shelter of an aged..."

speaker: Daphne
text: Niles.  [_He follows her into the kitchen._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Let's not do this tonight, not with her here.  I want it to be perfect.

speaker: Niles
text: You're right, we'll just...we'll just pick a better moment.  [_Julia enters.  Daphne does not see, as she is checking the cupborad._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll still be pregnant tomorrow. [_She hands Niles a box of Cap'n Crunch._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_also not seeing Julia_] Exactly.

speaker: Julia
text: [_exiting, followed by Niles_] Well, congratulations, Niles, Frasier didn't tell me that Daphne was pregnant.

speaker: Niles
text: [_mortiied_] What?

speaker: Martin
text: She is?

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, no, don't tell me she's just paunchy.

speaker: Niles
text: [_indignant_] She's not paunchy, she's pregnant.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_entering with milk_] Niles!!  [_He jumps, spilling cereal everywhere._]

speaker: Daphne
text: How could you do that?

speaker: Julia
text: I'm sorry, it's my fault.  I heard you in the kitchen.  I didn't realize it was a big deal.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what does it matter how we came to know this glorious news? Niles, that's wonderful! [_The brothers embrace over the table._]

speaker: Julia
text: Two words: C-section.  My sister's about your size, and when she had her kid it blew out the whole region.  [_Niles and Daphne stand mystified at Julia's apparently ignorant rudeness._]

speaker: Martin
text: Can I have cereal too?  [_Niles hands him the box._]  [_Scene 5 - Frasier's apartment Time fade.  Julia is sitting in Martin's chair, Frasier behind her on a bench, and the other three on the couch.  They are eating dessert._]

speaker: Julia
text: So, the more pregnant _she_ gets, the more the husband hits on me, and by the way, she was a model. [_Her phone rings again._] Whoops.  That's me.  Hey, how you doing?  No, i'm just...meeting my boyfriend's family.  [_She exits to the kitchen.  Martin quickly claims his chair._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_now clearly struggling somewhat_] Isn't this fun?  I'm having a good time.

speaker: Daphne
text: She certainly takes a lot of calls at dinnertime.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, that's exactly the kind of...flaw that the old Frasier would have...seized upon as a pretext to end the relationship, but I-I know now that...that impulse to run is-is really an indication that my feelings for her are just deepening, and um...[_Niles and Daphne stare at him with pained, disbelieving faces_] gone are the days when I would have said something like...[_exhaling deeply, and clearly meaning it_] "How rude!" or "She's horrible.  I've made a ghastly, ghastly mistake." [_He puts on his forced smile again._]

speaker: Julia
text: [_calling from the kitchen_] Hey, Marty, you're a Mariners fan.  They won in the tenth on a grand slam.  [_Martin glares at Frasier._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Who's ready to play that game of pictionary we talked about?  I know I am.  Let me just get that. [_running back to get the game equipment_] Dad, I'll tell you what,  I know how much you like to keep time, so you'll be the timer, and then it'll be me and Julia against Niles and Daphne.  How about that? [_He sets up an easel with poster paper._]

speaker: Julia
text: [_re-entering_] Oh, that sounds good to me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, what do you say you draw first?

speaker: Daphne
text: Ooh, all right. [_seeing the clue_] Oh, boy.

speaker: Martin
text: Ready...set, go.  [_Daphne draws a simple circle._]

speaker: Niles
text: _The Ring of the Nibelungen._

speaker: Daphne
text: Right!

speaker: Julia
text: Damn!

speaker: Frasier
text: Wow!  Well, congratulations, you two.  Great.

speaker: Julia
text: All right, enough of that, get your head in the game, we're starting from behind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right, okay, here we go. [_taking a clue_]  Yeah, right.  Okay, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Go.  [_Frasier draws a circle with a stem._]

speaker: Julia
text: [_shouting guesses quickly_] A ball.  A balloon.  Oh, an apple!  A bomb. The circle.  Oh, the circle of life.  [_Frasier adds a sombrero and a mustache to the "apple"._]

speaker: Julia
text: Uh, I don't know.  [_Frasier points to the hat._]

speaker: Julia
text: Yeah, I'm looking at it.  Well, maybe if you point to it harder, I'll get it.  Give me something to work with, dummy!  [_Frasier draws a huge circular arrow pointing to the hat._]

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, a hat!  The Cat in the Hat!  Uh, Abraham Lincoln!

speaker: Martin
text: Time!

speaker: Julia
text: [_leaping out of her seat and screeching_] Oh, "From Here to Eternity," I got that in!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's, that's not it.

speaker: Julia
text: What the hell is it?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a cherry with a mustache and, uh, wearing a sombrero.  It's "Cherry Garcia."

speaker: Julia
text: Oh, my God, that is the worst drawing I've ever seen. [_She's right about that._] I mean, even these cheaters [_indicating Niles and Daphne_] wouldn't have gotten that one.

speaker: Daphne
text: Cheaters?

speaker: Julia
text: I saw you guys mouthing at each other.  And I think Father Time here cut us off a little early, too.  Here, give me that pen, I'll show you how it's done.  Sit down.  Oh, my God, I mean, this painting is just...  [_She has been very rapidly eating small pieces of candy during the game. She now chokes on one as she stands next to the easel.  It looks serious. Frasier has gone to get the clue bag, now looking somewhat exasperated but maintaining his patience, and doesn't see Julia choking.  Martin, Niles, and Daphne silently and uncomfortably look at each other as she grabs at her throat, and do nothing.  Frasier turns around and sees._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, dear God!  [_She manages to cough it up and recover.  Frasier comes to her._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you all right?

speaker: Julia
text: Yes, I just, I think I need to splash a little cold water on my face.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, right, here, let me just, uh, walk you to the powder room.

speaker: Julia
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that's okay, you just take as long as you need.  [_She goes into the powder room and Frasier closes the door._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to the three in a low voice, with outrage_] Shame on you!  That woman couldn't _breathe_ , and the three of you just sat there!

speaker: Martin
text: You didn't exactly jump in yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's because I mistook her choking for a sarcastic comment on my Pictionary play!  You, on the other hand, were content to let the woman I love die before your eyes, THAT'S RIGHT, I SAID I LOVE HER!!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, knock it off, Frasier, you don't love her.  You're just trying to talk yourself into honoring your ill-advised commitment.

speaker: Frasier
text: How dare you presume to know the workings of my heart?  You can't understand the kind of feelings Julia and I have for one another. You might as well ask me to describe the essence of music or the, the color of starlight!  [_Julia exits the bathroom with one of Frasier's new and cherished Italian towels._]

speaker: Julia
text: Nice towels, Frasier, you'd think a couple of old ladies lived here.  [_He has managed to tolerate everything she has said and done to this point, but THAT crossed the line._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Get out.

speaker: Julia
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Frasier
text: I said get out!

speaker: Julia
text: I'm sorry, have you just lost your mind?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, that happened earlier when we slept together!

speaker: Julia
text: Are you breaking up with me?

speaker: Frasier
text: You're damn right I am!

speaker: Julia
text: I want my purse!

speaker: Frasier
text: And I, _my hand towel_!!  [_They exchange.  Julia begins to exit._]

speaker: Julia
text: I can't believe this.  You're actually kicking me out?

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you want me to draw you a picture?!

speaker: Julia
text: We'd be here all night!

speaker: Frasier
text: Get out!  [_She does, closing the door behind her.  Time fade._]  **AFTER THE BILE IS OVER**  [_Scene 6 - Frasier's apartment Later in the evening.  Frasier is proposing a toast._]

speaker: Frasier
text: With this bottle, I would like to both commemorate and apologize for this evening.  Daphne, Niles, this should have been your evening, and I selfishly monopolized every moment of it.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: Not yet, Niles. [_He pours._] Anyway, I handled things badly, both with Julia and with you, and I just hope that you can forgive me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Of course we will.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, look on the bright side.  You could have let her choke to death, but you didn't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then, to life, both the old and the new.  [_They clink glasses._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Niles, I'm so proud of you.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  [_Frasier sits on the couch.  Niles joins him._]

speaker: Martin
text: I'm excited for you, Daphne.  Takes me back to when I had my kids. So, what are you hoping for, boy or girl?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I don't know.  Be kind of nice to have a boy.  [_Frasier is showing off his towel to Niles._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, just look at the edging on this.

speaker: Niles
text: Have you ever?  Have you ever?  And look, this is all hand-stitched.

speaker: Frasier
text: Mm-hmm.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_philosophically_] Or a girl.  Either way.  [_They drink.  It should be noted that Daphne's glass contains orange juice. Fade out._]
